blocks.name: cgru
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include the class of all Grothendieck universes.
blocks.origin: const class cgru { Univ }

blocks.name: diff.cgru.s
diff.cgru.c
diff.cgru.w
df-gru
blocks.content: A Grothendieck universe is a set that is closed with respect to all the operations that are common in set theory: pairs, powersets, unions, intersections, Cartesian products etc. Grothendieck and alii, Séminaire de Géométrie Algébrique 4, Exposé I, p. 185. It was designed to give a precise meaning to the concepts of categories of sets, groups... (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jun-2013.)

blocks.name: elgrug
blocks.content: Properties of a Grothendieck universe. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jun-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm elgrug(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wcel(c0, cgru), wa(wtr(c0), wral(s0, c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(s0)), c0), wral(s1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c0)), wral(s1, co(c0, cmap, cv(s0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(s1))), c0)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  elab2g(hs0, c0, c1, cgru, wa(wtr(c0), wral(s0, c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(s0)), c0), wral(s1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c0)), wral(s1, co(c0, cmap, cv(s0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(s1))), c0))))), wa(wtr(cv(hs0)), wral(s0, cv(hs0), w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(s0)), cv(hs0)), wral(s1, cv(hs0), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cv(hs0))), wral(s1, co(cv(hs0), cmap, cv(s0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(s1))), cv(hs0)))))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wtr(cv(hs0)), wral(s0, cv(hs0), w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(s0)), cv(hs0)), wral(s1, cv(hs0), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cv(hs0))), wral(s1, co(cv(hs0), cmap, cv(s0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(s1))), cv(hs0))))), wtr(c0), wral(s0, c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(s0)), c0), wral(s1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c0)), wral(s1, co(c0, cmap, cv(s0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(s1))), c0)))))
  treq(cv(hs0), c0)
  raleqbi1dv(s0, cv(hs0), c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(s0)), cv(hs0)), wral(s1, cv(hs0), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cv(hs0))), wral(s1, co(cv(hs0), cmap, cv(s0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(s1))), cv(hs0)))), w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(s0)), c0), wral(s1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c0)), wral(s1, co(c0, cmap, cv(s0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(s1))), c0))))
  3anbi123d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cpw(cv(s0)), cv(hs0)), wral(s1, cv(hs0), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cv(hs0))), wral(s1, co(cv(hs0), cmap, cv(s0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(s1))), cv(hs0))), wcel(cpw(cv(s0)), c0), wral(s1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c0)), wral(s1, co(c0, cmap, cv(s0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(s1))), c0)))
  eleq2(cv(hs0), c0, cpw(cv(s0)))
  raleqbi1dv(s1, cv(hs0), c0, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cv(hs0)), wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c0))
  eleq2(cv(hs0), c0, cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  raleqbidv(s1, co(cv(hs0), cmap, cv(s0)), co(c0, cmap, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(s1))), cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(s1))), c0))
  oveq1(cv(hs0), c0, cmap, cv(s0))
  eleq2(cv(hs0), c0, cuni(crn(cv(s1))))
  df-gru(hs0, s0, s1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wtr(c0), wral(s0, c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(s0)), c0), wral(s1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c0)), wral(s1, co(c0, cmap, cv(s0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(s1))), c0))))))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: grutr
blocks.content: A Grothendieck universe is transitive. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Jan-2017.)

blocks.name: gruelss
blocks.content: A Grothendieck universe is transitive, so each element is a subset of the universe. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jun-2013.)

blocks.name: grupw
blocks.content: A Grothendieck universe contains the powerset of each of its members. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jun-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm grupw(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cgru), wcel(c1, c0)), wcel(cpw(c1), c0))
} = {
  imp(wcel(c0, cgru), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(cpw(c1), c0))
  3syl(wcel(c0, cgru), wi(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(cpw(c1), c0)), wral(hs0, c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0)))), wral(hs0, c0, wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0)))
  simprd(wcel(c0, cgru), wral(hs0, c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0)))), wtr(c0))
  ibi(wcel(c0, cgru), wa(wtr(c0), wral(hs0, c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0))))))
  elgrug(hs0, hs1, c0, cgru)
  ralimi(hs0, c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0))), wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0))
  simp1(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0)))
  rspccv(hs0, c0, c1, wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wcel(cpw(c1), c0))
  eleq1d(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0, cpw(c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  pweq(cv(hs0), c1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cpw(c1), c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm grupw(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Univ ∧ c1 ∈ c0)→ P(c1)∈ c0)
} = {
  imp(c0 ∈ Univ, c1 ∈ c0, P(c1)∈ c0)
  3syl(c0 ∈ Univ, (c1 ∈ c0 → P(c1)∈ c0), ∀(hs0 ∈ c0,(P(hs0)∈ c0 ∧ ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, { hs0, hs1 } ∈ c0)∧ ∀(hs1 ∈(c0[↦]hs0), ⋃ ran(hs1)∈ c0))), ∀(hs0 ∈ c0, P(hs0)∈ c0))
  simprd(c0 ∈ Univ, ∀(hs0 ∈ c0,(P(hs0)∈ c0 ∧ ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, { hs0, hs1 } ∈ c0)∧ ∀(hs1 ∈(c0[↦]hs0), ⋃ ran(hs1)∈ c0))), Tr(c0))
  ibi(c0 ∈ Univ, (Tr(c0)∧ ∀(hs0 ∈ c0,(P(hs0)∈ c0 ∧ ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, { hs0, hs1 } ∈ c0)∧ ∀(hs1 ∈(c0[↦]hs0), ⋃ ran(hs1)∈ c0)))))
  elgrug(hs0, hs1, c0, cgru)
  ralimi(hs0, c0, (P(hs0)∈ c0 ∧ ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, { hs0, hs1 } ∈ c0)∧ ∀(hs1 ∈(c0[↦]hs0), ⋃ ran(hs1)∈ c0)), P(hs0)∈ c0)
  simp1(P(hs0)∈ c0, ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, { hs0, hs1 } ∈ c0), ∀(hs1 ∈(c0[↦]hs0), ⋃ ran(hs1)∈ c0))
  rspccv(hs0, c0, c1, P(hs0)∈ c0, P(c1)∈ c0)
  eleq1d(P(hs0), c0, P(c1), hs0 = c1)
  pweq(hs0, c1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(P(c1)∈ c0)
}

blocks.name: gruss
blocks.content: Any subset of an element of a Grothendieck universe is also an element. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jun-2013.)

blocks.name: grupr
blocks.content: A Grothendieck universe contains pairs derived from its elements. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jun-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm grupr(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cgru), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(cpr(c1, c2), c0))
} = {
  3imp(wcel(c0, cgru), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(cpr(c1, c2), c0))
  com23(wcel(c0, cgru), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(cpr(c1, c2), c0))
  syl6(wcel(c0, cgru), wcel(c2, c0), wi(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(cpr(c1, c2), c0)), wral(hs0, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), c2), c0)))
  syl5com(wcel(c0, cgru), wcel(c2, c0), wral(hs0, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), c2), c0)), wral(hs0, c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0)))))
  simprd(wcel(c0, cgru), wral(hs0, c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0)))), wtr(c0))
  ibi(wcel(c0, cgru), wa(wtr(c0), wral(hs0, c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0))))))
  elgrug(hs0, hs1, c0, cgru)
  ralimdv(hs0, c0, wcel(c2, c0), w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0))), wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), c2), c0))
  com12(wcel(c2, c0), w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0))), wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), c2), c0))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0)), wi(wcel(c2, c0), wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), c2), c0)))
  rspccv(hs1, c0, c2, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0), wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), c2), c0))
  eleq1d(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0, cpr(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))
  preq2(cv(hs1), c2, cv(hs0))
  rspccv(hs0, c0, c1, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), c2), c0), wcel(cpr(c1, c2), c0))
  eleq1d(cpr(cv(hs0), c2), c0, cpr(c1, c2), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  preq1(cv(hs0), c1, c2)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c2, c0))
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), c2), c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cpr(c1, c2), c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm grupr(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Univ ∧ c1 ∈ c0 ∧ c2 ∈ c0)→ { c1, c2 } ∈ c0)
} = {
  3imp(c0 ∈ Univ, c1 ∈ c0, c2 ∈ c0, { c1, c2 } ∈ c0)
  com23(c0 ∈ Univ, c1 ∈ c0, c2 ∈ c0, { c1, c2 } ∈ c0)
  syl6(c0 ∈ Univ, c2 ∈ c0, (c1 ∈ c0 → { c1, c2 } ∈ c0), ∀(hs0 ∈ c0, { hs0, c2 } ∈ c0))
  syl5com(c0 ∈ Univ, c2 ∈ c0, ∀(hs0 ∈ c0, { hs0, c2 } ∈ c0), ∀(hs0 ∈ c0,(P(hs0)∈ c0 ∧ ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, { hs0, hs1 } ∈ c0)∧ ∀(hs1 ∈(c0[↦]hs0), ⋃ ran(hs1)∈ c0))))
  simprd(c0 ∈ Univ, ∀(hs0 ∈ c0,(P(hs0)∈ c0 ∧ ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, { hs0, hs1 } ∈ c0)∧ ∀(hs1 ∈(c0[↦]hs0), ⋃ ran(hs1)∈ c0))), Tr(c0))
  ibi(c0 ∈ Univ, (Tr(c0)∧ ∀(hs0 ∈ c0,(P(hs0)∈ c0 ∧ ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, { hs0, hs1 } ∈ c0)∧ ∀(hs1 ∈(c0[↦]hs0), ⋃ ran(hs1)∈ c0)))))
  elgrug(hs0, hs1, c0, cgru)
  ralimdv(hs0, c0, c2 ∈ c0, (P(hs0)∈ c0 ∧ ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, { hs0, hs1 } ∈ c0)∧ ∀(hs1 ∈(c0[↦]hs0), ⋃ ran(hs1)∈ c0)), { hs0, c2 } ∈ c0)
  com12(c2 ∈ c0, (P(hs0)∈ c0 ∧ ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, { hs0, hs1 } ∈ c0)∧ ∀(hs1 ∈(c0[↦]hs0), ⋃ ran(hs1)∈ c0)), { hs0, c2 } ∈ c0)
  3ad2ant2(P(hs0)∈ c0, ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, { hs0, hs1 } ∈ c0), ∀(hs1 ∈(c0[↦]hs0), ⋃ ran(hs1)∈ c0), (c2 ∈ c0 → { hs0, c2 } ∈ c0))
  rspccv(hs1, c0, c2, { hs0, hs1 } ∈ c0, { hs0, c2 } ∈ c0)
  eleq1d({ hs0, hs1 }, c0, { hs0, c2 }, hs1 = c2)
  preq2(hs1, c2, hs0)
  rspccv(hs0, c0, c1, { hs0, c2 } ∈ c0, { c1, c2 } ∈ c0)
  eleq1d({ hs0, c2 }, c0, { c1, c2 }, hs0 = c1)
  preq1(hs0, c1, c2)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(c2 ∈ c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.w({ hs0, c2 } ∈ c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w({ c1, c2 } ∈ c0)
}

blocks.name: gruurn
blocks.content: A Grothendieck universe contains the range of any function which takes values in the universe (see ~ gruiun for a more intuitive version). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jun-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm gruurn(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cgru), wcel(c1, c0), wf(c2, c1, c0)), wcel(cuni(crn(c2)), c0))
} = {
  3impia(wcel(c0, cgru), wcel(c1, c0), wf(c2, c1, c0), wcel(cuni(crn(c2)), c0))
  sylbird(wa(wcel(c0, cgru), wcel(c1, c0)), wf(c2, c1, c0), wcel(cuni(crn(c2)), c0), wcel(c2, co(c0, cmap, c1)))
  elmapg(c0, cgru, c1, c0, c2)
  imp(wcel(c0, cgru), wcel(c1, c0), wi(wcel(c2, co(c0, cmap, c1)), wcel(cuni(crn(c2)), c0)))
  3syl(wcel(c0, cgru), wi(wcel(c1, c0), wi(wcel(c2, co(c0, cmap, c1)), wcel(cuni(crn(c2)), c0))), wral(hs0, c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0)))), wral(hs0, c0, wi(wcel(c2, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0))), wcel(cuni(crn(c2)), c0))))
  simprd(wcel(c0, cgru), wral(hs0, c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0)))), wtr(c0))
  ibi(wcel(c0, cgru), wa(wtr(c0), wral(hs0, c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0))))))
  elgrug(hs0, hs1, c0, cgru)
  ralimi(hs0, c0, w3a(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0))), wi(wcel(c2, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0))), wcel(cuni(crn(c2)), c0)))
  3ad2ant3(wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), c0), wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cpr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0)), wral(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0)), wi(wcel(c2, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0))), wcel(cuni(crn(c2)), c0)))
  rspccv(hs1, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), c2, wcel(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0), wcel(cuni(crn(c2)), c0))
  eleq1d(cuni(crn(cv(hs1))), c0, cuni(crn(c2)), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))
  unieqd(crn(cv(hs1)), crn(c2), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))
  rneq(cv(hs1), c2)
  rspccv(hs0, c0, c1, wi(wcel(c2, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0))), wcel(cuni(crn(c2)), c0)), wi(wcel(c2, co(c0, cmap, c1)), wcel(cuni(crn(c2)), c0)))
  imbi1d(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(c2, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0))), wcel(cuni(crn(c2)), c0), wcel(c2, co(c0, cmap, c1)))
  eleq2d(c2, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)), co(c0, cmap, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  oveq2(cv(hs0), c1, c0, cmap)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)))
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(cuni(crn(c2)), c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wi(wcel(c2, co(c0, cmap, c1)), wcel(cuni(crn(c2)), c0)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm gruurn(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Univ ∧ c1 ∈ c0 ∧(c2 : c1 → c0))→ ⋃ ran(c2)∈ c0)
} = {
  3impia(c0 ∈ Univ, c1 ∈ c0, (c2 : c1 → c0), ⋃ ran(c2)∈ c0)
  sylbird((c0 ∈ Univ ∧ c1 ∈ c0), (c2 : c1 → c0), ⋃ ran(c2)∈ c0, c2 ∈(c0[↦]c1))
  elmapg(c0, cgru, c1, c0, c2)
  imp(c0 ∈ Univ, c1 ∈ c0, (c2 ∈(c0[↦]c1)→ ⋃ ran(c2)∈ c0))
  3syl(c0 ∈ Univ, (c1 ∈ c0 →(c2 ∈(c0[↦]c1)→ ⋃ ran(c2)∈ c0)), ∀(hs0 ∈ c0,(P(hs0)∈ c0 ∧ ∀(hs1 ∈ c0, { hs0, hs1 } ∈ c0)∧ ∀(hs1 ∈(c0[↦]hs0), ⋃ ran(hs1)∈ c0))), ∀(hs0 ∈ c0,(c2 ∈(c0[↦]hs0)→ ⋃ ran(c2)∈ c0)))

blocks.name: gruiun

blocks.name: gruuni
blocks.content: A Grothendieck universe contains unions of its elements. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Jun-2013.)

blocks.name: grurn
blocks.content: A Grothendieck universe contains the range of any function which takes values in the universe (see ~ gruiun for a more intuitive version). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jun-2013.)

blocks.name: gruima

blocks.name: gruel
blocks.content: Any element of an element of a Grothendieck universe is also an element of the universe. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jun-2013.)

blocks.name: grusn
blocks.content: A Grothendieck universe contains the singletons of its elements. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jun-2013.)

blocks.name: gruop
blocks.content: A Grothendieck universe contains ordered pairs of its elements. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Jun-2013.)

blocks.name: gruun

thm grudomon(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Univ ∧ c1 ∈ On ∧(c2 ∈ c0 ∧ c1[≼]c2))→ c1 ∈ c0)

  3com23(c0 ∈ Univ, c1 ∈ On, (c2 ∈ c0 ∧ c1[≼]c2), c1 ∈ c0)
  3impia(c0 ∈ Univ, (c2 ∈ c0 ∧ c1[≼]c2), c1 ∈ On, c1 ∈ c0)
  impr(c0 ∈ Univ, c2 ∈ c0, c1[≼]c2, (c1 ∈ On → c1 ∈ c0))
  com3l((c0 ∈ Univ ∧ c2 ∈ c0), c1[≼]c2, c1 ∈ On, c1 ∈ c0)
  tfis3(hs0, hs1, c1, ((c0 ∈ Univ ∧ c2 ∈ c0)→(c1[≼]c2 → c1 ∈ c0)), ((c0 ∈ Univ ∧ c2 ∈ c0)→(hs0[≼]c2 → hs0 ∈ c0)), ((c0 ∈ Univ ∧ c2 ∈ c0)→(hs1[≼]c2 → hs1 ∈ c0)))
  imbi2d(hs0 = hs1, (c0 ∈ Univ ∧ c2 ∈ c0), (hs0[≼]c2 → hs0 ∈ c0), (hs1[≼]c2 → hs1 ∈ c0))
  imbi12d(hs0 = hs1, hs0[≼]c2, hs0 ∈ c0, hs1[≼]c2, hs1 ∈ c0)
  breq1(hs0, hs1, cdom, c2)
  eleq1(hs0, hs1, c0)
  imbi2d(hs0 = c1, (c0 ∈ Univ ∧ c2 ∈ c0), (hs0[≼]c2 → hs0 ∈ c0), (c1[≼]c2 → c1 ∈ c0))
  imbi12d(hs0 = c1, hs0[≼]c2, hs0 ∈ c0, c1[≼]c2, c1 ∈ c0)

blocks.name: gruina
blocks.content: If a Grothendieck universe ` U ` is nonempty, then the height of the ordinals in ` U ` is a strongly inaccessible cardinal. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Jun-2013.)

blocks.name: grutsk1
blocks.content: Grothendieck universes are the same as transitive Tarski classes, part one: a transitive Tarski class is a universe. (The hard work is in ~ tskuni .) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Jun-2013.)
